help.info:
Alerts provide regular updates on important data and notify users when the data meets a specific condition.

To create an alert, open a report with the desired data settings, then right-click and select New Alert. You can then specify the following:

conditionInfo.label: Condition:
conditionInfo.info: What data to monitor and how the alert is triggered. This can include searching for specific values or ranges.

frequencyInfo.label: Frequency:
frequencyInfo.info: When the condition is checked. This can be based on data changes or calendars.

notifyInfo.label: Notify:
notifyInfo.info: Who receives notifications and reports when the alert is triggered.

reportInfo.label: Report:
reportInfo.info: Create a file (Pdf, Excel, HTML/XML, or tab-delimited) that displays the monitored data when the alert is triggered. You can attach this report to the alert notification, or send it to an external location.

Attribute.heading: Attribute
Attribute.description: An attribute field requires query expressions that define how the attribute’s value is to be determined for the records on the table.

Calculated.heading: Calculated
Calculated.description: A calculated field contains a value determined by RapidResponse and cannot be modified. A calculated key field returns a reference to a calculated table.

Functions.heading: Function
Functions.description: A function field contains table-specific business logic saved and maintained within a field definition, and can be added to either input or calculated fields.

Reference.heading: Reference
Reference.description: To include a reference field in an expression, a period (.) must be included after each table the expression travels through to access the desired field. A reference key field returns a reference to the table’s key fields.

Key.heading: Key
Key.description: A key is used to identify records.

Vector.heading: Vector
Vector.description: A vector set represents a set of date-phased detail records for each record in the table.

text.helpText: Label controls let you provide information and context for form users by adding titles, descriptions, and headers for groups of controls.
text.stylePreview: Aa Bb Cc Dd Ee Ff Gg Hh Ii Jj Kk

number.helpText: Numeric Input controls let users supply positive and negative integer values, as well as decimals.

button.helpText: Button controls let users perform actions, such as clicking OK to submit values. The label property controls the text that is displayed, while the Action property describes the actions that will happen when users click the button.

checkbox.helpText: Checkbox controls let users select a Boolean value, such as whether to include or exclude historical tables in a calculation.

date.helpText: Date Picker controls let users specify time-dependent information, such as a due date. This control displays both a date field and date categories (such as Past and Future), using the date format from the user's default browser.

dropDown.helpText: List Picker controls let users select from a list of values. The Display Values property determines what the users see, while the Data Values property defines the values that are submitted. For example, you can use customer names as the display value and customer IDs as the data value.

fileInput.helpText: File Upload controls let users upload text files (.txt, .tab, .csv) that are up to 30 MB in size. For example, an administrator could use this control to upload an external list of users into the form.

image.helpText: Add images to your forms, such as your company logo, to provide additional context.

errors.maxSize: Please upload a valid image file less than 1MB.
errors.nonImageFile: The selected file is not a supported image file. Select a supported image file for upload.
errors.nonImageURL: The selected URL is not a supported image. Select a supported image to link.

scenarioPicker.helpText: Scenario Picker controls let users specify a scenario that data changes are applied to. When a form already has a Scenario Picker control, you can use its value as the Scenario property value in Drop Down controls, so that the data reflects the scenario that the user selected in the Scenario Picker.

section.helpText: Sections let you group related components into an area that can be expanded and collapsed.

textArea.helpText: Multi-line text controls accept multiple lines of text, such as a Message. The text can either be pre-defined by the form author, or typed in by the user. Text controls only accept string values made up of alphanumeric characters.

textInput.helpText: Text Input controls accept a single line of text, such as a Subject. The form author can either define a default value, or allow the user to enter a value.

placeholder.prompt: Drag a control from the panel to start

tabBar.helpText: Tabs organize components into distinct groups that the user can easily navigate between.

panel.helpText: Panel controls allow the user to group related controls.

divider.helpText: A divider is a line that you can use to separate groups of related form components from each other.

htmlText.helpText: The rich text control accepts multiple lines of text and images. This control offers custom formatting.

widget.helpText: The widget control allows you to reference a common widget resource shared across multiple dashboards

menuButton.helpText: The menu button control accepts menu item controls as children and displays them when clicked.

menuItem.helpText: The menu item control can be used to populate the contents of a menu button control.

frame.helpText: The frame control allows users to wrap child components in a container.

visualization.helpText: The visualization control allows users to display data as a visualization.

grid.helpText: Specify workbook and worksheet data you want to display on the dashboard. Under Settings, select the desired workbook from the drop-down menu. Then select the worksheet to review the data on the dashboard.

textLink.helpText: The text link control can be used to display text that performs a specified actions when clicked.

notifications.helpText: The notifications control can be used to display the user's current notifications.

treemap.helpText: The treemap control can be used to display a treemap.

expression-builder-ui.helpText: The Expression Builder can be used to create query expressions. You can create an expression using any number of fields, operators, functions, variables, worksheet identifiers, column values, but the expression must be valid. In addition, a very large expression can take a long time to calculate, and might impact system performance. You should try to keep your expression short whenever possible.

filterProperties.dialogHelp:
Filters control the results you see in your reports. 
You can choose what values are included from the selected data field. The "Included" list shows what values your report will display. 
Manage the list using the checkboxes, or by multi-selecting and right-clicking for actions. Hover your cursor over the included values for editing options. 
Use the Expression tab to create more complex logic for what values are allowed through the filter.
filterProperties.simpleViewDialogHelp:
Filters control the results you see in your reports. 
You can choose what values are included from the specified data field. The "Included" list shows what values your report will display. Hover your cursor over a value for editing options. You can multi-select and right-click to manage multiple values at once. 
Click "More Options" to add more values or write an expression.

helpText.start: Review each dependent resource and how it will be handled during the import process. Import actions can include:
helpText.list:
- Import: Import as a new private resource.

 - Use existing public: Don't import the file, and use the existing public resource.

- Use existing private: Don't import the file, and use the existing private resource.

- Use existing: Don't import the file, and use the existing component.

- Replace: Import the file, and replace the existing resource with this one.

- Rename: Import the file with a unique name that you specify.

- Skip: Don't import the resource. This is useful when importing a new resource that you don't have permission to create. However, you can only skip importing a dependent resource if it's defined it as optional.
helpText.end: You may also be able to review export notes, change the resource name or view the version history. For more information, see the RapidResponse Resource Authoring (Web client) guide.

helpContent.bodyText:
Create one or more rules in order to format column data based on specified conditions. When you create a rule, you can specify which columns it will apply to, which values you want to base the conditions on, and which format style you want to apply to any data that meets the conditions.

Rules are applied in the order in which they're listed. After a rule sets a specific attribute type (text color, background color, or font style) for a cell, no other rule can change it. Therefore, you should add rules in the order that you want the formats to be applied and ensure the rule with the most restrictive condition is first.

placeholder.readOnlyText: Conditional formatting rules apply to columns. Conditions are applied in the order they are listed, but only one formatting rule of each type (background color, text color, or font style) is applied to a cell.

resourceHelp.hierarchyHelp: Displays data for the value selected in the hierarchy. Each data value in a hierarchy summarizes data from all levels below it.
resourceHelp.multiScenarioHelp: Click the Scenarios control and then click Select Scenarios to select different scenarios to view data from. You can also change the order of the scenarios by dragging them up or down the list. The baseline scenario is the one that is displayed first in the worksheet, and the values in comparison scenarios are compared to the baseline. The baseline scenario's name is the one displayed in the Scenarios control. The data displayed in the comparison scenario columns can be shown as actual values, differences from the baseline scenario, or differences expressed as percentages.
resourceHelp.singleScenarioHelp: Displays a particular version of your data.
resourceHelp.filterHelp: Displays data based on specific criteria defined within the filter, making the information in the worksheet manageable and relevant.

resourceHelp.constraintHelp: Displays data for the selected constraint.

deletedRecordDetailDialog.title: Delete Record?
deletedRecordDetailDialog.help: Deleting a record can have a significant impact on your data. When you delete a record, you’re actually deleting all of the information related to that record from the active scenario. If the deleted record is referenced by a record in another table, that referencing record is also deleted. This can result in a large number of records being deleted.
